item.title: About Me
item.description: About Me I’m a student at Digital Arts and Entertainment. I’m a fluent C++ developer capable of using modern programming patterns to create maintainable and stable applications. I have a personal interests in modern technologies, hence my preference for modern C++ and Rust. Programming has always been a hobby for me and I’m looking forward to brining this enthusiasm to the work floor. Feel free to check out some of my projects or look at my CV.

item.title: C++ Raytracer
item.description: NOTE: This document describes my learning experience creating this project, see the Github Repo for technical details. Introduction My raytracer project, made for the Graphics Programming 1 course, is a C++ project that renders 3d figures. It runs completely on the CPU, as GPU ray-tracing was outside of the scope of this course. item.title: Minigin
item.description: NOTE: This document describes my learning experience creating this project, see the Github Repo for technical details. Introduction The minigin project was part of the Programming 4 course at Digital Arts and Entertainment. The project is a game engine written in C++, with a qbert clone to show it in action. Learned Skills During the development of this project, I learned the following skills: Structuring a large C++ project Usage of programming patterns Parsing Json files Version Control using git

item.title: Trash Raccoons
item.description: NOTE: This document describes my learning experience creating this project. Feel free to check out the game itself on Itch. YouTube Video Introduction Trash Raccoons is a multiplayer couch coop game created during the Game Projects course at Digital Arts and Entertainment. With a group of 3 people (2 artists and 1 programmer) we where tasked to create a game together. In Trash Raccoons, players play as raccoons that try to collect as much trash as possible and deliver this trash back to the garbage truck.
